title: Bankruptcy debt discharged 10 years ago
question: in 1998 filed for bankruptcy and had my credit card debts discharged. i have been receiving a notice about once or twice a year from Global Rated Asset Trust, serviced by NCO Financial Systems that i assumed was for my current mortgage lender and credit card issuer checking on my credit status. but i got curious about it when i received the most recent one, and called them. it turns out that it is from one of the credit card companies that i had my debt discharged with. the back of the notice says that it is an attempt to collect a debt by a debt collector. can you give me any insight to why they are checking my credit still, and if this is legal? my bankruptcy was in California where i still reside.
answers:
If the debt was properly listed and discharged, they are not legally able to continue to attempt to collect it.

You should speak to a bankruptcy attorney, who can check the old case to see what it contained. The National Association of Consumer Advocates is a non-profit consumer advocacy organization. NACA maintains a web site at www.naca.net where it lists geographically consumer law attorneys all over the US. Please look there for someone in your area who specializes in bankruptcy to advise you.
